book.title: Pride and Prejudice
book.author: Jane Austen
book.edition: Text digitised from 1923 R.W.Chapman edition, itself a first edition with selected corrections form second and third editions.

notes.note: "every body" and "everybody" used inconsistently (31 vs 3) – left as found
"your's" and "yours" used inconsistently (11 vs 3) – left as found
"Philips" and "Phillips" used inconsistently (30 vs 5) – left as found
"Lady Catherine" and "lady Catherine" used inconsistently (97 vs 7) – left as found
"piano forte" and "piano-forte" used inconsistently – left as found
"drawing room" and "drawing-room" used inconsistently – left as found
"to day" and "to-day" used inconsistently – left as found
"neices" spelt incorrectly twice – left as found
"gentlemanlike" and "gentleman-like" used inconsitstently – left as found
"threadbare" and "thread-bare" used inconsistently – left as found
"godson" and "god-son" used inconsistently – left as found
"exstacy" and "ecstacy" used inconsistently – left as found
"tête à tête", "tête-à-tête" and "tete-a-tete" left as found
"se'night" and se'nnight used inconsistently – left as found
"headach" and "headache" used inconsistently – left as found
"some-where" and "somewhere" used insconsistently – left as found
"stedfastly" and "steadfastly" used inconsistentlt – left as found
Line 17: ' changed to "
Line 1: Lack of comma after "I dare say" confirmed with paper edition
Line 5: "afterwards" confirmed with paper edition
Line 34: Incorrect ” removed
Line 38: mantlepiece retained, but cf p190 line 17.
Line 25: "in behalf" is correct (checked against paper edition)
Line 16: Missing "." added after "Mr"
Line 15: "Headach" is correct (archaic spelling)
Line 13: "sallad" is correct (archaic spelling)
Line 18: "incumbrance" is correct (archaic spelling)
Line 8: "," changed to "." cf p2, p132
Line 7: soft hyphen assumed for mantle-*piece – one of each in the text
Line 16: "Chesnuts" is correct (archaic spelling)
Line 3: "secresy" is correct (archaic spelling)
"Line 19: villanous is correct (archaic spelling)
Line 45: "to night" changed to "to-night"
Line 19: "dont" changed to "don't"
Line 9: ' changed to "
Line 21: "Mrs Bennet" changed to "Mrs. Bennet"
Line 7: "to a lady Catherine" in all editions.
Line 37: extra "be" removed
